doc:
Danny Kaye https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danny_Kaye 0 Danny Kaye (born David Daniel Kaminsky; January 18, 1911 – March 3, 1987) was an American actor, singer, dancer, comedian, musician, and philanthropist. His performances featured physical comedy, idiosyncratic pantomimes, and rapid-fire novelty songs. Kaye starred in 17 movies, notably Wonder Man (1945), The Kid from Brooklyn (1946), The Secret Life of Walter Mitty (1947), The Inspector General (1949), Hans Christian Andersen (1952), White Christmas (1954), and The Court Jester (1956). His films were popular, especially his performances of patter songs and favorites such as "Inchworm" and "The Ugly Duckling." He was the first ambassador-at-large of UNICEF in 1954 and received the French Legion of Honour in 1986 for his years of work with the organization. Danny_Kaye ( born David_Daniel_Kaminsky ; January_18_,_1911 – March_3_,_1987 ) was an_American_actor , singer , dancer , comedian , musician , and philanthropist . His_performances featured physical_comedy , idiosyncratic_pantomimes , and rapid-fire_novelty_songs . Kaye starred in 17_movies , notably_Wonder_Man_(_1945_) , The_Kid from Brooklyn_(_1946_) , The_Secret_Life of Walter_Mitty_(_1947_) , The_Inspector_General_(_1949_) , Hans_Christian_Andersen_(_1952_) , White_Christmas_(_1954_) , and The_Court_Jester_(_1956_) . His_films were popular , especially his_performances of patter_songs and favorites such_as " Inchworm " and " The_Ugly_Duckling . " He was the_first_ambassador-at-large of UNICEF in 1954 and received the_French_Legion of Honour in 1986 for his_years of work with the_organization .
